name: J. Patrick House Bed and Breakfast Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at the JPH and perhaps the best we've had even when the power went out all over town. The weather provided the perfect outlet for having a quiet evening in front of the fireplace. Breakfast was as good and the other guests were great to chat with during the wine and cheese hour and during breakfast. The owner is a wealth of information and creates a fun and lively environment for all.
reviews.title: The Perfect Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at the J Patrick House in Cambria. We had a lovely stay in the B&B and stayed in the Limerick room.
reviews.title: Lovely stay at the J Patrick House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Cambria is beautiful place and we visited the Big Sur, Hearst Castle and saw many Elephant Seals near San Simeon.
reviews.title: Life with Stuffed Animals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were great and the owners friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations and reservations. The wine-tasting hour in the afternoon is a great idea and a wonderful opportunity to meet other guests. Free wireless internet in the main building, not in our room.
reviews.title: Converted me to B&B travel......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a very pleasant stay and highly recommended.
reviews.title: Enchanting place Delicghtful People

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our recent stay at the J. Patrick House. John was very friendly and helpful. Gave us great directions to a "secret" place to watch the elephant seals. The stuffed french toast at breakfast was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great B and B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the J Patrick House during our slow drive to my dad's house in Scotts Valley (Santa Cruz). Enjoyed the innkeeper's hospitality and warmth, as well as the cozy room with a fireplace. Their close proximity to wine tasting in Paso Robles and one of my favorite beach towns of Cayucos is a plus.
reviews.title: Thanksgiving trip to Santa Cruz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again if we visit the Central Coast.
reviews.title: Very thin walls.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice people who take great care of you. Lovely surroundings. Good breakfast. Very thin walls.
reviews.title: Relaxing Getaway in Lovely Cambria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights in the Limerick room, which has wooden walls, giving ti a rustic feel. our room was upstairs, with trees outside the window. We enjoyed the easy to start fireplace (wood burning but with a gas assist for those of us who are fire starting challenged).
reviews.title: Stay at J Patrick House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at J.Patrick House was one of the highlights of our California Trip. Nestled in the hills of Cambria, this wonderful cottage like lodge was easy to find, and filled with warmth. The staff there are fabulous. Owners who truly care about each guest. The kitchen smells of delicious food and aromas all day long. Our room "the Kerry Room" was perfect! Nice big comfy bed, we fell asleep with a lovely fire burning low. Private bathroom that was well stocked with great products. Plenty of guest parking. Our room overlooked the back of the main house, the garden walkway is delightful. Wine and cheese tasting at night and all the local restaurant menus on hand for you to peruse. Breakfast was to die for! Homemade fragrant spiced bread, yogurt and granola along with an egg concoction so delicious I am still craving it. I couldnt eat it all and it was incredible. Best breakfast my entire trip.
reviews.title: Delicious, delectible fare meets delightful comforts"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Make sure you buy some local raisins and homemade granola for you to enjoy when you return home...well worth it to taste your trip later and reminisce. Wish I still had some.
reviews.title: Great B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was that we didn't stay longer.
reviews.title: the best!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this place! It has a lot of character. Cozy room (The Limerick) with a very comfortable bed. Great breakfast! Very friendly staff- Laurie was very helpful and welcoming. We will stay again when we are back in the area.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable, lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room- matched the picture - very comfortable beds and pillow.
reviews.title: Dissapointed in Tipporary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with the food and service that was provided. It was perfectly located to explore the surrounding wine country and San Simeon. While surprised by the lack of a TV, it really made no difference. The host and his helpers were very knowledgeable and generous with their recommendations. The other guests were so interesting and fun to talk to.
reviews.title: Charm among the trees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful stay at the J. Patrick House! From the minute we walked in to the moment we left........we felt SO comfortable and relaxed and pampered! The owners and staff put so much attention to every little detail.....from the generous, delicious breakfasts, to the evening wine and cheese hour, to the CD's in your room...to the cookies and milk at night!! They go above and beyond what we ever could have imagined in our wildest dreams!! Thanks SO much John and staff for a truly memorable 25th anniversary! We definitely will be back and will recommend to anyone!
reviews.title: 25th Anniversary trip.....they made us feel so special!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A quiet location in a very busy area. Very clean and well organized. Nice host/hostess.
reviews.title: Quaint Inn, off the beaten path, great Breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was fantastic, and the rooms are very comfortable. Our hostess was so warm and welcoming and full of great recommendations for local restaurants and sight seeing. The garden is lovely, and the garden room is really charming. We had a wonderful time. Wine and cheese in the evening. Cookies and milk in the evening. Really wonderful.
reviews.title: Irish charm on the California coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been to JPH years ago for Valentine's day, and returned 5 years later for our anniversary. First time we stayed at the Kilkenny room, this time we chose the Donegal room. Spacious, charming, romantic, clean, stylish, gas/wood burning fireplace in the room, full bathroom. John is a great host and creates wonderful breakfast masterpieces. The first night innkeeper Lori recommended and made dinner reservations for us, the second night John did so also. The JPH innkeepers are well respected, so when they call to make reservations, you get a great table. It's the little things that make a big difference. The cute chocolate mint on the night stand, the "killer" cookies downstairs (with milk), the sound of the water fountain, the relaxing music CD player in the room, the room diary journal that has entries from thousands of people spanning over a decade, the Wine and Cheese hour in the evening is nice, meet people from various places, (and if you brought your laptop... the unadvertised linksys wireless open access internet access). In the past we've stayed one night, now we know that 2 nights are ideal to slow down and enjoy Cambria. John and his staff work hard behind the scenes to make your stay relaxing, peaceful and enjoyable.
reviews.title: We Love the J Patrick House, Bed and Breakfast
